To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

nodes.body:
Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/7312e0ff-7c8c-4935-a843-5d3f3a8be347) for commit dfb9ef9c00c58edf71849523bc75e2ab048e307a.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/dd5fa8cf-5031-4b09-b0ee-75fc27db825a/to/7312e0ff-7c8c-4935-a843-5d3f3a8be347) against commit 7a1bf932d49ac6f72417c8faa8ae60e006f6db5d.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#8316~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7086732077/job/19285557365)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7086732077/job/19285557951)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7086732077/job/19285556795)

Oh, actually this lemma isn't marked `@[simp]` (and same with a few above). Should it be? If not, it seems inconsistent to use `no_index`, because if we cared about `rw?` and `exact?`, we would've been using `no_index` on RHS's too.
Ugh, I don't know. Cargo culting this porting note can only go so far, maybe we need a zulip thread.
Since this isn't `@[simp]`, I'm gonna push a commit removing the `no_index` but adding a comment to remind us about `no_index` if we make them `@[simp]` in the future.
Having thought about this a bit more, I think the rules apply even if its not `simp`, as you can always use `simp [not_a_simp_lemma]`

Okay, I'll revert. It would be consistent then to require `no_index` on RHSs too, since you can always `simp [← not_a_simp_lemma]`, but let's eschew consistency for now to avoid churn since hopefully https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/issues/2867 will be addressed soon anyway.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix: add missing `no_index` around `OfNat.ofNat `

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: add lemmas for nat literals corresponding to lemmas for nat casts
